intro: Baccharis pseudovaccinioides, commonly known as the Brazilian baccharis, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including disturbed soils and open woodlands. Its adaptability makes it a common ornamental and ecological plant in regions with warm climates.
